Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as eefe49bf0e204a102324709315ba9a693a50ecbb
Based on discussion with manoj.. I made the changes.
having ifdefs are not the right way to do. can you figure out a way to get the oem handler here.
this string check's are really bad. why are doing string checks ?

one line commit message does not help. Improve the commit message.

Improve commit message based on https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#formatting-commit-messages
why a c style parameter passing ? why not const string reference ?

please dont mask all the errors and do nothing about it ? 

do you want to continue in case of any exceptions ? that does not sound correct.
will throw std::cerr incase of exception.

When i meant by any exception is - > the exceptions can be Internal Error or Time out e.t.c 

we should have a clear understanding on how pldm would work in all those specific exceptions. (if not we should at least have a rationale as to why we are catching all the exceptions generically rather than a specific one )

refer : https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/anti-patterns.md#handling-unexpected-error-codes-and-exceptions
can you add a comment here , explaining what does continue mean here ?
Any item which is a FRU should by default implement the Inventory.Item Interface and host the present property. So if present property is not hosted means FRU is absent.

I think the default should be false, as any item which is a FRU should by default implement the Inventory.Item Interface and host the present property.

So by any change if we dont have that - that should be considered as an absent fru.
if this trace is printed , then i dont think it will be any useful , because you would not know which FRU is it ?
